quotes.quote: There is no great genius without some touch of madness.
You're only given a little spark of madness. You mustn't lose it.
Madness is rare in individuals - but in groups, parties, nations, and ages it is the rule.
It is madness for sheep to talk peace with a wolf.
Too much sanity may be madness.
Madness in method, that's genius.
Madness is surprisingly freeing.
Sanity is madness put to good use.
Madness is no madness when shared.
Madness is the acme of intelligence.
Every desire has a relation to madness.
You just have to trust your own madness.
Resisting madness is the maddest way of being mad.
At the edge of madness you howl diamonds and pearls.
You have to quit confusing a madness with a mission.
To be sane in a world of madman is in itself madness.
Sometimes it's only madness that makes us what we are.
Madness is the result not of uncertainty but certainty.
Madness is just what a genius looks like to a tiny mind.
Madness is only an amplification of what you already are.
Madness need not be all breakdown. It may also be break-through.
Our occasional madness is less wonderful than our occasional sanity.
Madness is badness of spirit, when one seeks profit from all sources.
Truly great madness can not be achieved without significant intelligence.
Optimism is the madness of insisting that all is well when we are miserable.
Madness was only a handicap only if you couldn't control its irrationalities.
Madness is a divine release of the soul from the yoke of custom and convention.
Madness might sometimes give access to a kind of knowledge. But was not a guarantee.
Madness is only a variety of mental nonconformity and we are all individualists here.
Madness is a regenerating thing. Like a phoenix, when one strand dies, another burns anew.
